illie
som
ganske
rigtig
klart
iremgaaer
af
bemyndigelsen
skeer
fyldest
ved
gjerning
og
ikke
ved
tomme
ord
—
ministeren
fremhæver
derimod
at
man
gaaer
den
feile
vei
naar
man
forlanger
bemyndigelsen
udfort
førend
nogen
plan
foreligger
han
appellerer

til
ihingets
og
publikums
sunde
sands
om
man
af
denne
grund
kan

at
lade
alle
disse
embedsmænd
lide
skaar
i
indtægt
j
hansen

bemærke
at
folkethinget
kun

af

udarbejdede
og
kongen
forelagte
plan
hvorpaa

støtter
sig
—

svarer
at
det
har
været

at

imellem
nakflov
og

1
1
i

den
26de
mai
1858
beiinspecteurcn
har
yttret
at

i
andragendet
givne

af
veiens

er
overdreven
og
al

i
det

er

ta

imellem

og
asser

under

er

for

fasthed

et

nye
organisation
for
brandvæsenets
eget
vedkommende
vil
kunne
flee
i
april
maaned
have
vi
endnu
ikke
kunnet
erfare

dre
vil
kunne
tjene
til
at
frie
ham
for
ansvar
at
de
paaklagede
mringer
indeholde«
i
et
af
ham
affattet
forsvarsskrift
hvilket
han
har
anseet
sig
berettiget
til
at
osfentliggjyre
som
de
ere
ansete
i
strafbare
ved
en
usvækket
dom
vil
han
der
ikke
kan
antages
at
have

i

og

er
dyml
som
anfyrt

at
onsee

den
ovencsterede
lovbestemmelse
med
fængsel
efter
omstændighederne
i
4

yvor
hos
de
2
sidstnævnte
rumere
af
det
beryl
te
blad
i
medspr
af
samme
lov«
12
ville
være
at
confiflere
ligesom
han
og
vil
have
at
udrede
actionens
omkostninger
derunder
salairer
til
generalfiflalen
30
rd
og
til
defensor
procu
rator
alberti
10
rd
sagfyrelsen
har
været

kjobenhavns
vandvacrk
og
har
tungs
vand
opstandere
og
vandda
ner
det
er
en
anerkjendt

at
enhver
indretnings
overforelse
fra
et

til

afpasset

naar

kan
have
nogen
indflydelse
ved

fra
udlandet
her
til
staden

vand

altsaa

an

vort

at
vi

af

ikke

paa

den

er
ovenfor

lydige
børn
søger
imod
forud
betaling
en

huusleilighed
til
en

af
100

end

etage

et

paa

en

han«

have

—
i
rigsdagsmændenes
private
mode
i

af

til
en

i

med
nogle

af

til

»danske
mænd«

at

til

et

for

i

det

i

jstedetfor

til
og
under

nr
78

junuftnslurnurefommiqcn
for
rortige
eiendete
i
rorrrjylland
til
esterretning
sor
de
landboere
som
onste
at

i
assurancesoreningen

at

lobig

som

kan

fra

og
indtil

af
det

den

lovmassigt
kan

at

paalignende

er

pr
portion
hvad

have

hele

eller

af

med

i
the
general
remarks
of
the
committee
and
the
revenues
the
governor
stated
that
the
general
views
of
the
committee
differ
from
those
on
which
the
draft
has
been
framed
and
this
divergence
has
its
cause
principally
in
the
greater
weight
attached
by
the
committee
to
the
present
unfavorable
circumstances
than
he
had
attributed
to
them
with
regard
to
the
revision
of
the
system
of
taxation
recommended
by
the
committee
he
was
of
opinion
that
a
general
measure
of
this
nature
would
require
very
extensive
preparatory
investigations
and
discussions
and
consequently
retard
the
fulfilment
of
the
desired
object
he
considered
it
a
more
practically
useful
proceeding
as
followed
in
the
report
to
point
out
certain
taxes
as
requiring
a
reform
he
agrees
with
the
committee
on
the
expediency
of
abolishing
the
donble
export
duty
but
apprehends
that
the
expectations
entertained
of
the
results
of
the
measure
is
exaggerated
he
considered
it
impracticable
to
annul
an
item
of
revenue
of
87824
by
a
simple
amendment
to
the
draft
the
duty
is
imposed
by
a
law
and
can
only
be
abolished
by
a
law
and
he
remarked
that
the
report
only
mentions
the
double
export
duty
on
produce
when
shipped
to
foreign
countries
although
the
same
duty
is
paid
also
on
produoe
shipped
to
denmark
in
foreign
vessels
respecting
the
wish
expressed
by
the
committee
to
have
the
value
of
the
produce
fixed
to
the
produce
for
a
longer
period
at
a
time
as
a
rule
for
rating
the
duty
it
is
not
clear
in
what
manner
the
producer
would
thereby
be
benefitted
as
it
is
accidental
whether
after
the
amount
is
determined
the
price
should
rise
or
fall
and
in
the
latter
case
the
tax
would
fall
heavier
to
change
the
levying
of
the
duty
so
as
to
make
it
payable
together
with
the
taxes
on
the
estates
would
cause
a
risk
of
a
partial
loss
but
the
matter
will
be
taken
under
consideration
and
perhaps
means
may
be
found
to
overcome
that
difficulty
with
regard
to
the
observations
made
on
the
subject
of
smuggling
investigations
will
be
made
but
it
is
not
impossible
that
the
measures
to
be
taken
for
more
efficiently
obviating
the
evil
complained
of
will
unavoidably
be
accompanied
by
inconveniences
to
the
trading
and
travelling
public
and
this
side

the
question
ought
not
entirely
to
be
lost
sight
of
the
1st
member
for
christiansted
arnesen
as
reporter
of

committee
